meanings.definition: The lower surface of a bird's wing.
meanings.sent1: The underwing of the bird was a different color than the top.
meanings.sent2: The ornithologist carefully examined the underwing of the eagle.
meanings.sent3: The underwing of the seagull was ticklish, making it hard to inspect.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity soared like a bird's underwing, hidden yet powerful.
meanings.sent5: The underwing of the butterfly was a vibrant display of colors.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that provides support or protection from below.
meanings.sent1: The underwing of the team, the coach, always encouraged them.
meanings.sent2: The underwing of the tree provided shade on hot days.
meanings.sent3: The underwing of the umbrella protected her from the unexpected rain.
meanings.sent4: His friendship was like an underwing, always there to support.
meanings.sent5: The underwing of the mentor guided her through difficult times.

meanings.definition: To shelter or protect from below.
meanings.sent1: She would underwing her younger siblings during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The mother bird would underwing her chicks from the rain.
meanings.sent3: He decided to underwing his friend from the harsh truth for now.
meanings.sent4: The community came together to underwing those affected by the disaster.
meanings.sent5: The knight vowed to underwing the kingdom from any harm.
